article:
Kabzaa (2023 film)

Kabzaa is a 2023 Indian Kannada-language period action film written and directed by R. Chandru. The film stars Upendra, Kiccha Sudeep, and Shriya Saran in the lead roles. The movie is set in the 1940s and is based on the true events of the underworld of Bengaluru during that era.

# Plot

The story of Kabzaa revolves around Arkeshwara (Upendra), a young man from a humble background who becomes a powerful underworld don in Bengaluru. The film explores his transformation from a small-time goon to a notorious gangster, as well as his relationships with his family and friends. The movie also delves into the world of crime and corruption in Bengaluru during the 1940s, highlighting the struggles and challenges faced by the people living in the city during that time.

As Arkeshwara rises to power, he attracts the attention of the police and other underworld figures, who seek to bring him down. The film follows his rise and fall, as well as the consequences of his actions on those around him. Through Arkeshwara's story, the movie sheds light on the darker aspects of human nature and the consequences of succumbing to greed and ambition.

# Cast

* Upendra as Arkeshwara
* Kiccha Sudeep as Bhargava Bakshi
* Shriya Saran as Madhu
* Shivarajkumar as a special appearance
* Murali Sharma as a police officer
* Danish Akhtar Saifi as a goon
* Avinash as a politician

# Production

Kabzaa was directed by R. Chandru, who also wrote the screenplay and dialogue. The film was produced by Anand Pandit Motion Pictures and Sri Siddeshwara Enterprises. The movie was shot on a budget of ₹50 crore and took over two years to complete. The film's shooting locations included Bengaluru, Mangaluru, and Hyderabad.

The film's cinematography was handled by A.J. Shetty, while the editing was done by Mahesh Reddy. The action sequences were choreographed by Ravi Verma, and the stunt team included experts from Bollywood and Hollywood. The film's costume design was handled by Santhosh Patil, who created period-specific costumes for the lead actors.

# Music

The music for Kabzaa was composed by Ravi Basrur, who also worked on the film's background score. The movie features six songs, including "Kabzaa Title Track", "Madhu Madhu", "Bhoothnath", "Habibi Habibi", "Bengaluru Bengaluru", and "Salaam Rocky Bhai". The songs were written by Yogaraj Bhat, Santhosh Ananddram, and V. Nagendra Prasad.

The film's songs were well-received by the audience and critics alike, with "Madhu Madhu" and "Bengaluru Bengaluru" becoming chart-toppers. The movie's background score was also praised for its effectiveness in enhancing the film's emotional impact.

# Marketing

The marketing campaign for Kabzaa began several months before the film's release, with the production team releasing a series of teasers and trailers. The film's first teaser was released on YouTube in January 2023, and it quickly went viral. The film's trailer was released in February 2023, and it received a massive response from the audience.

The production team also organized several promotional events, including a press conference and a song launch event. The film's lead actors, Upendra and Kiccha Sudeep, also promoted the movie on their social media handles.

# Release

## Theatrical

Kabzaa was released in theaters on March 17, 2023. The film opened to a massive response from the audience, with many theaters reporting sold-out shows. The movie received a U/A certificate from the Central Board of Film Certification.

The film was released in over 500 theaters across Karnataka, and it also opened in theaters in other states, including Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, and Telangana. The movie was also released in several countries, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and Australia.

## Home media

Kabzaa was released on Amazon Prime Video on April 21, 2023. The film's digital rights were acquired by Amazon Prime Video for a reported ₹20 crore.

# Reception

## Box office

Kabzaa was a massive commercial success, grossing over ₹150 crore at the box office. The film opened to a strong start, collecting over ₹20 crore on its opening day. The movie's collections continued to grow over the weekend, with the film collecting over ₹50 crore in its opening weekend.

The film's success can be attributed to its strong word-of-mouth and positive reviews from critics. The movie's collections continued to grow over the weekdays, with the film collecting over ₹100 crore in its first week.

## Critical response

Kabzaa received positive reviews from critics, with many praising the film's story, direction, and performances. The movie's action sequences and background score were also praised by critics.

The film's lead actors, Upendra and Kiccha Sudeep, received praise for their performances, with many critics praising their chemistry on screen. The movie's supporting cast, including Shriya Saran and Murali Sharma, also received praise for their performances.

However, some critics felt that the film's pacing was slow, and the movie's runtime was too long. Some critics also felt that the film's story was predictable, and the movie's climax was not effective.

Overall, Kabzaa was a well-received film that was praised for its story, direction, and performances. The movie's success can be attributed to its strong word-of-mouth and positive reviews from critics.

article:
Endless Summer Vacation
=======================

Endless Summer Vacation is the eighth studio album by American singer-songwriter Miley Cyrus, released on March 10, 2023, through Columbia Records. The album marks Cyrus' first release since her 2020 album Plastic Hearts. Endless Summer Vacation is a fusion of pop, rock, and electronic dance music, with lyrics that explore themes of love, heartbreak, and self-discovery.

Background and Recording
------------------------

Cyrus began working on Endless Summer Vacation in 2020, shortly after the release of Plastic Hearts. She collaborated with a variety of producers and songwriters, including Max Martin, Shellback, and Andrew Watt, to create an album that would showcase her growth as an artist. The recording process took place in various studios around the world, including Los Angeles, New York City, and Stockholm.

Cyrus has stated that the album was inspired by her own experiences with love and heartbreak, as well as her observations of the world around her. She wanted to create an album that would be both personal and universal, with songs that would resonate with listeners on a deep level.

Composition
------------

Endless Summer Vacation is a diverse album that incorporates a range of musical styles and influences. The album's sound is characterized by lush vocal harmonies, catchy melodies, and a blend of electronic and organic instrumentation.

The album's opening track, "Flowers," is a upbeat pop song with a driving beat and a catchy chorus. The song's lyrics explore themes of love and empowerment, with Cyrus declaring her independence and celebrating her individuality.

Other standout tracks on the album include "Jaded," a moody electro-pop song with a haunting vocal performance, and "Rose Colored Lenses," a dreamy ballad with a soaring chorus.

Release and Artwork
-------------------

Endless Summer Vacation was released on March 10, 2023, through Columbia Records. The album's artwork features a photograph of Cyrus posing on a beach, surrounded by palm trees and a bright blue sky. The image is a nod to the album's title and themes, which evoke a sense of freedom and escapism.

The album's packaging includes a deluxe edition with a bonus track, as well as a vinyl release with a limited edition clear vinyl variant.

Promotion
----------

### Singles

The album's lead single, "Flowers," was released on January 13, 2023. The song was a commercial success, reaching the top 10 in several countries, including the US, UK, and Australia.

The album's second single, "Jaded," was released on February 17, 2023. The song's music video premiered on Cyrus' YouTube channel and features the singer performing the song in a dark and moody setting.

### Music Videos

The music video for "Flowers" premiered on Cyrus' YouTube channel on January 13, 2023. The video features Cyrus performing the song in a colorful and upbeat setting, surrounded by dancers and musicians.

The music video for "Jaded" premiered on Cyrus' YouTube channel on February 17, 2023. The video features Cyrus performing the song in a dark and moody setting, with a focus on her vocal performance and emotional expression.

Critical Reception
-----------------

Endless Summer Vacation received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. Reviewers praised the album's diverse sound, Cyrus' vocal performance, and the album's themes of love and self-discovery.

 Rolling Stone magazine described the album as "a triumph," praising Cyrus' vocal range and emotional expression. The New York Times praised the album's " infectious melodies and Cyrus' confident vocals."

### Year-End Lists

Endless Summer Vacation appeared on several year-end lists, including Rolling Stone's "Best Albums of 2023" and Billboard's "Top 10 Albums of 2023."

Commercial Performance
----------------------

Endless Summer Vacation was a commercial success, reaching the top 10 in several countries, including the US, UK, and Australia. The album debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart, with sales of over 100,000 copies in its first week.

Accolades
----------

Endless Summer Vacation received several awards and nominations, including a Grammy Award nomination for Best Pop Vocal Album.

2022 US Open – Women's Singles

The 2022 US Open Women's Singles tournament was the 142nd edition of the US Open, the fourth and final Grand Slam event of the year. The tournament took place at the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing Meadows, New York City, from August 29 to September 10, 2022.

The seeds for the 2022 US Open Women's Singles tournament were announced on August 25, 2022. The seeds were based on the WTA rankings as of August 22, 2022. The top 32 players in the rankings received a seed, with the top eight seeds receiving a bye in the first round.

article:
Bigg Boss (Telugu TV series) Season 7
=====================================

Bigg Boss Telugu Season 7 is the seventh season of the Telugu version of the Indian reality television series Bigg Boss, produced by Endemol Shine India. The season premiered on September 3, 2023, and is being broadcast on Star Maa. Akkineni Nagarjuna returned as the host for the seventh consecutive season.

Production
-----------

### Eye Logo

The eye logo of Bigg Boss Telugu Season 7 was unveiled on August 24, 2023, featuring a futuristic design with a circular shape and a pupil that resembles a camera lens. The logo represents the all-seeing eye of Bigg Boss, which constantly monitors the activities of the housemates.

### Teasers

The first teaser of Bigg Boss Telugu Season 7 was released on August 17, 2023, featuring Akkineni Nagarjuna as the host. The teaser hinted at the theme of the season, which is "Aagalla Anthe" (Until the End).

### Concept

The concept of Bigg Boss Telugu Season 7 revolves around the theme "Aagalla Anthe" (Until the End), which suggests that the housemates will face numerous challenges and obstacles throughout their journey in the Bigg Boss house.

### 24x7 streaming

Like previous seasons, Bigg Boss Telugu Season 7 is being streamed 24x7 on the Disney+ Hotstar platform, allowing viewers to watch the live feed of the Bigg Boss house at any time.

### Voting process

The voting process for Bigg Boss Telugu Season 7 is similar to previous seasons, where viewers can vote for their favorite contestants through the Disney+ Hotstar app or by giving a missed call to a designated number.

Housemates status
----------------

The housemates of Bigg Boss Telugu Season 7 are a mix of celebrities and commoners from various backgrounds. The contestants were selected through a rigorous audition process, and the final list of contestants was announced on September 3, 2023.

Housemates
------------

### Original entrants

The original entrants of Bigg Boss Telugu Season 7 include:

1. Aaradhya
2. Abhinay
3. Akhil Sarthak
4. Amma Rajasekhar
5. Anushka
6. Avinash Kalla
7. Deepthi Sunaina
8. Gautham
9. Himaja
10. Jabardasth Mahesh
11. Kireeti Damaraju
12. Mehaboob
13. Noel Sean
14. Punarnavi Bhupalam
15. Ravi Krishna
16. Sreerama Chandra
17. Tanish Alladi
18. Varun Sandesh

### Wild card entrants in 2.0 launch

The wild card entrants of Bigg Boss Telugu Season 7 include:

1. Hemanth

3. Kajal

5. Monal Gajjar
6. Rakesh
7. Surya
8. Swetha Varma

Twists

article:
Elizabeth II

Elizabeth II (Elizabeth Alexandra Mary; 21 April 1926 – 8 September 2022) was the monarch of the United Kingdom and other Commonwealth realms from 6 February 1952 until her death. She was the longest-reigning British monarch, serving for over 70 years.

#Early life

Elizabeth was born in London as the first child of Prince Albert, Duke of York (later King George VI), and his wife, Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon (later Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother). Her father was the second son of King George V and Queen Mary, and at the time of her birth, there was little expectation that she would inherit the throne. She had one younger sister, Princess Margaret. Elizabeth was educated at home, with a governess and private tutors, and developed a strong interest in dogs, horses, and the outdoors.

#Heir presumptive

##Second World War

During the Second World War, Elizabeth and her sister were evacuated to the countryside for their safety. In 1940, Elizabeth made her first radio broadcast, addressing other children who had been evacuated from cities. She began to take on more public duties, accompanying her parents to events and visiting troops.

##Marriage

In 1947, Elizabeth married Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, a former prince of Greece and Denmark. The couple had met while Elizabeth was still a princess, and Philip had renounced his Greek and Danish titles to become a British citizen. They had four children: Charles, Prince of Wales; Anne, Princess Royal; Prince Andrew, Duke of York; and Prince Edward, Earl of Wessex.

#Reign

##Accession and coronation

Elizabeth's father died on 6 February 1952, and she ascended to the throne at the age of 25. Her coronation took place on 2 June 1953, at Westminster Abbey, and was broadcast on television for the first time. Elizabeth's reign was marked by significant changes in British society, including the decolonization of Africa and Asia, the rise of the welfare state, and the emergence of the United Kingdom as a global economic power.

##Early reign

In the early years of her reign, Elizabeth faced several challenges, including the Suez Crisis in 1956, which damaged British relations with the United States and the Commonwealth. She also had to navigate the complex relationships between the British government, the Commonwealth, and the European Economic Community (EEC), the precursor to the European Union.

##Political reforms and crises

The 1960s and 1970s saw significant social and cultural changes in the United Kingdom, including the decriminalization of homosexuality, the abolition of capital punishment, and the rise of the feminist movement. Elizabeth's government also faced several crises, including the miners' strike of 1972 and the three-day week of 1973-74.

##Perils and dissent

In the 1980s, Elizabeth faced several challenges to her authority, including the Falklands War with Argentina, the miners' strike of 1984-85, and the poll tax riots of 1989. She also had to navigate the complex relationships between the British government, the European Union, and the Commonwealth, particularly during the Maastricht Treaty negotiations.

##Turbulent years

The 1990s were marked by significant personal and professional challenges for Elizabeth, including the divorce of her son Charles from Diana, Princess of Wales, and the subsequent death of Diana in a car accident in Paris. Elizabeth's "annus horribilis" speech in 1992, in which she described the year as "horrible," was seen as a rare moment of public candor from the monarch.

##Dawn of the new millennium

In the 2000s, Elizabeth's reign was marked by several significant events, including the devolution of power to Scotland and Wales, the introduction of the euro currency in several European countries, and the war in Iraq. Elizabeth also celebrated several significant milestones, including her Golden Jubilee in 2002 and the 60th anniversary of her accession to the throne in 2012.

##Diamond Jubilee and milestones

In 2012, Elizabeth celebrated her Diamond Jubilee, marking 60 years since her accession to the throne. The celebrations included a flotilla on the River Thames, a concert at Buckingham Palace, and a tour of the United Kingdom. Elizabeth also celebrated several other milestones, including the birth of her great-grandson Prince George in 2013 and the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings in 2014.

##Pandemic and widowhood

In 2020, the United Kingdom was affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, which had a significant impact on the country's economy, healthcare system, and society. Elizabeth's government implemented several measures to mitigate the effects of the pandemic, including lockdowns, social distancing measures, and vaccination programs. In 2021, Elizabeth's husband Prince Philip died at the age of 99, after a long illness.

##Platinum Jubilee and beyond

In 2022, Elizabeth celebrated her Platinum Jubilee, marking 70 years since her accession to the throne. The celebrations included a pageant, a concert, and a tour of the United Kingdom. However, Elizabeth's health began to decline, and she was forced to cancel several engagements. She died on 8 September 2022, at the age of 96, at Balmoral Castle in Scotland.

#Death

Elizabeth died on 8 September 2022, at the age of 96, at Balmoral Castle in Scotland. Her death was announced by the Royal Family, and tributes poured in from around the world. Elizabeth's funeral took place on 19 September 2022, at Westminster Abbey, and she was buried in the King George VI Memorial Chapel at St George's Chapel, Windsor Castle.

#Legacy

Elizabeth's legacy is complex and multifaceted, reflecting the changing times and circumstances of her long reign. She was a symbol of stability and continuity, and her dedication to duty and service was widely admired.

##Beliefs, activities, and interests

Elizabeth was a devout Christian, and her faith played an important role in her life and reign. She was also a keen supporter of the arts, and her patronage of music, theater, and visual arts helped to promote British culture around the world. Elizabeth was also a passionate advocate for animal welfare, and her love of dogs and horses was well-known.

##Media depiction and public opinion

Elizabeth's depiction in the media was often complex and multifaceted, reflecting the changing times and circumstances of her reign. She was portrayed as a symbol of tradition and continuity, but also as a modernizing force who helped to promote British culture and interests around the world. Public opinion of Elizabeth was generally positive, with many people admiring her dedication to duty and service.

#Titles, styles, honours, and arms

##Titles and styles

Elizabeth's titles and styles were:

* Elizabeth II (1952-2022)
* Defender of the Faith (1952-2022)
* Supreme Governor of the Church of England (1952-2022)
* Head of the Commonwealth (1952-2022)

##Arms

Elizabeth's arms were:

* The Royal Arms of the United Kingdom (1952-2022)
* The Royal Standard of the United Kingdom (1952-2022)

#Issue

Elizabeth's children were:

* Charles, Prince of Wales (b. 1948)
* Anne, Princess Royal (b. 1950)
* Prince Andrew, Duke of York (b. 1960)
* Prince Edward, Earl of Wessex (b. 1964)

#Ancestry

Elizabeth's ancestry was:

* Father: King George VI (1895-1952)
* Mother: Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother (1900-2002)
* Paternal grandfather: King George V (1865-1936)
* Paternal grandmother: Queen Mary (1867-1953)

2022–23 NHL Transactions

The 2022–23 NHL season was marked by a flurry of transactions that shaped the league's landscape. From retirements and contract terminations to free agency and trades, teams continually adjusted their rosters in pursuit of success. This article provides a comprehensive overview of the transactions that occurred during the 2022–23 NHL season.

# Retirement

Several players announced their retirement during the 2022–23 season, bringing an end to their NHL careers. Some notable retirees include:

* Zdeno Chára, a 45-year-old defenseman who played 24 seasons in the NHL, announced his retirement on September 20, 2022.
* Keith Yandle, a 36-year-old defenseman, announced his retirement on September 20, 2022, after playing 16 seasons in the NHL.
* Jason Zucker, a 31-year-old forward, announced his retirement on November 1, 2022, after playing 10 seasons in the NHL.

These players, among others, hung up their skates and left behind a lasting legacy in the NHL.

# Contract Termination

Several teams terminated contracts during the 2022–23 season, releasing players from their obligations. Some notable contract terminations include:

* The Arizona Coyotes terminated the contract of forward Phil Kessel on August 1, 2022.
* The Chicago Blackhawks terminated the contract of forward Colin Blackwell on August 15, 2022.
* The New Jersey Devils terminated the contract of defenseman Will Butcher on September 1, 2022.

These contract terminations allowed teams to free up cap space and make roster adjustments.

# Free Agency

Free agency played a significant role in shaping the NHL landscape during the 2022–23 season. Teams signed players to new contracts, and some notable free agent signings include:

* The New York Rangers signed forward Vincent Trocheck to a seven-year, $39.375 million contract on July 13, 2022.
* The Colorado Avalanche signed defenseman Josh Manson to a four-year, $18 million contract on July 13, 2022.
* The Florida Panthers signed forward Colin White to a one-year, $1.2 million contract on July 15, 2022.

## Imports

* The Carolina Hurricanes signed forward Ondrej Kase from the Czech Extraliga on June 1, 2022.
* The Minnesota Wild signed forward Adam Beckman from the Western Hockey League on July 1, 2022.

These imports added depth and talent to NHL rosters.

# Trades

article:
FBI Search of Mar-a-Lago

The FBI search of Mar-a-Lago refers to the search of former U.S. President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate in Palm Beach, Florida, on August 8, 2022. The search was conducted by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) as part of an ongoing investigation into Trump's handling of presidential records, including classified documents.

Background

Handling, storage, and disposition of U.S. government records

The Presidential Records Act (PRA) of 1978 requires the President to maintain custody and control of presidential records, which include documents, photographs, and other materials created or received by the President or his staff. The PRA also requires the President to transfer all presidential records to the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) at the end of his term.

Criminal laws listed on search warrant

The search warrant executed at Mar-a-Lago listed three potential crimes: violations of the Espionage Act, obstruction of justice, and concealment or removal of presidential records.

Classified material and the presidency

Declassification, presidential powers and regulations

The President has the authority to classify and declassify national security information. However, there are regulations and protocols in place to ensure that classified material is handled and stored properly. The President's authority to declassify material is not absolute and is subject to certain limitations and requirements.

Protocols for loss or compromise of classified material

When classified material is lost or compromised, there are protocols in place to report and respond to the incident. These protocols include notifying the relevant authorities, such as the FBI and the Director of National Intelligence, and conducting an investigation to determine the cause of the loss or compromise.

Events leading to the search

NARA actions to retrieve presidential records from Mar-a-Lago

In January 2022, NARA requested that Trump's representatives return all presidential records in their possession. Trump's team eventually returned 15 boxes of documents, but NARA later determined that some of these documents were classified.

Partial return of records to NARA

In May 2022, Trump's representatives returned an additional 38 documents to NARA, including 17 that were marked as classified.

Trump's statement regarding return of records

In a statement, Trump claimed that he had returned all of the documents requested by NARA and that the matter was closed.

NARA makes criminal referral

Despite Trump's claims, NARA referred the matter to the Department of Justice (DOJ) for investigation.

Tom Fitton's advice to Trump

Tom Fitton, the president of Judicial Watch, advised Trump to assert executive privilege and refuse to cooperate with the DOJ's investigation.

FBI/DOJ launches criminal investigation and issues subpoenas

May 2022 subpoena

In May 2022, the DOJ issued a subpoena to Trump's custodian of records, demanding the production of all documents and materials related to the presidential records.

June 2022 subpoena

In June 2022, the DOJ issued a second subpoena, seeking additional information and materials related to the presidential records.

FBI/DOJ obtains search warrant from federal court

After conducting an investigation and gathering evidence, the DOJ obtained a search warrant from a federal court to search Mar-a-Lago for presidential records and other materials.

Search of Mar-a-Lago

On August 8, 2022, the FBI executed the search warrant at Mar-a-Lago, searching for presidential records and other materials.

Search of other Trump properties

In addition to Mar-a-Lago, the FBI also searched other Trump properties, including his Bedminster, New Jersey, golf club.

Release of search warrant, property receipt, and affidavit

Release of search warrant and property receipt

The search warrant and property receipt were released to the public on August 12, 2022.

Seized materials

According to the property receipt, the FBI seized a total of 33 boxes of documents, including 11 sets of classified documents.

Missing materials

The property receipt also listed several missing items, including a document titled "Info re: President of France."

Motions to release search warrant affidavit

Several media outlets and advocacy groups filed motions to release the search warrant affidavit, arguing that it was in the public interest to know the basis for the search.

Release of redacted search warrant affidavit

On August 26, 2022, the DOJ released a redacted version of the search warrant affidavit, which included some of the information used to obtain the search warrant.

Release of detailed property list

On September 2, 2022, the DOJ released a detailed property list, which included a more detailed description of the materials seized during the search.

Trump v. United States

In August 2022, Trump filed a lawsuit against the United States, seeking to block the release of the search warrant affidavit and to obtain the return of the seized materials.

Special counsel investigation

Indictment

On August 25, 2022, a federal grand jury indicted a former Trump advisor, Stephen Bannon, for contempt of Congress.

Reactions

Congress

Members of Congress reacted to the search, with some Democrats praising the DOJ's actions and some Republicans criticizing them.

White House

The White House declined to comment on the search, citing the ongoing investigation.

National Archives

NARA released a statement, saying that it was cooperating with the DOJ's investigation and that it had referred the matter to the DOJ.

Trump, his family, and his attorneys

Claims of political motivation, planted evidence, and Obama precedent

Trump and his attorneys claimed that the search was motivated by politics and that the DOJ had "planted" evidence at Mar-a-Lago. They also claimed that President Obama had done the same thing.

Claims of declassifying all documents

Trump claimed that he had declassified all of the documents at Mar-a-Lago, but this claim was disputed by the DOJ.

Lawsuit

Trump filed a lawsuit against the United States, seeking to block the release of the search warrant affidavit and to obtain the return of the seized materials.

Trump allies and supporters

Threats against government officials

Some Trump allies and supporters made threats against government officials, including the judge who signed the search warrant.

FBI field office attack

On August 11, 2022, an armed man attacked an FBI field office in Cincinnati, Ohio, in apparent response to the search.

Republican elected officials and candidates

Many Republican elected officials and candidates criticized the search, with some calling for the impeachment of Attorney General Merrick Garland.

Congressional Democrats

Many Congressional Democrats praised the DOJ's actions, saying that they were necessary to protect national security.

Scholars and former officials

Many scholars and former officials praised the DOJ's actions, saying that they were necessary to enforce the law.

Intelligence community

The intelligence community praised the DOJ's actions, saying that they were necessary to protect national security.

Former Trump administration figures

Some former Trump administration figures, including former Attorney General William Barr, praised the DOJ's actions.

article:
Sudanese civil war (2023–present)

The Sudanese civil war is an ongoing conflict that began in April 2023 between the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF) and the Rapid Support Forces (RSF), a paramilitary group. The conflict has resulted in thousands of casualties and displaced hundreds of thousands of people.

#Background

##War in Darfur and the formation of the RSF

The war in Darfur, which began in 2003, led to the formation of the Rapid Support Forces (RSF), a paramilitary group led by Mohamed Hamdan Dagalo, also known as Hemedti. The RSF was initially formed as a militia group to fight against rebel groups in Darfur, but it has since evolved into a powerful force with its own military equipment and personnel.

##Political transition

In 2019, a popular uprising led to the ousting of President Omar al-Bashir, who had ruled Sudan for over three decades. A transitional government was formed, led by a sovereign council consisting of military and civilian leaders. However, the transitional government struggled to maintain stability and address the country's economic and social challenges.

##Origins of the SPLM-N and the SLM

The Sudan People's Liberation Movement-North (SPLM-N) and the Sudan Liberation Movement (SLM) are two rebel groups that have been fighting against the Sudanese government for years. The SPLM-N was formed in 2011, after South Sudan gained independence from Sudan. The SLM was formed in 2002, during the war in Darfur.

##Prelude

Tensions between the SAF and the RSF had been building for months before the conflict began. In March 2023, the RSF seized control of a key military base in Khartoum, leading to clashes between the two groups. The conflict escalated in April 2023, when the RSF launched a surprise attack on the SAF in Khartoum.

#Course of the war

##April–May 2023

###Battle of Khartoum

The battle of Khartoum was a key turning point in the conflict. The RSF launched a surprise attack on the SAF in Khartoum, catching the military off guard. The SAF responded with airstrikes and artillery fire, but the RSF was able to hold its ground. The battle lasted for several days, resulting in hundreds of casualties on both sides.

###Treaty of Jeddah

On May 11, 2023, the SAF and the RSF signed the Treaty of Jeddah, a ceasefire agreement brokered by Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates. The treaty called for a ceasefire and the withdrawal of RSF forces from Khartoum. However, the treaty was short-lived, and fighting resumed in June 2023.

##June–September 2023

###Continued fighting in Khartoum

Despite the Treaty of Jeddah, fighting continued in Khartoum, with both sides accusing each other of violating the ceasefire. The RSF launched a series of attacks on SAF positions in the city, while the SAF responded with airstrikes and artillery fire.

###Diplomatic efforts

International efforts to broker a peace agreement between the SAF and the RSF continued throughout June and July 2023. The African Union and the United Nations led diplomatic efforts, but a breakthrough was not achieved.

###SPLM-N (Al-Hilu) involvement

In July 2023, the SPLM-N, led by Abdelaziz al-Hilu, announced its support for the RSF. The SPLM-N has been fighting against the Sudanese government for years, and its involvement in the conflict marked a significant escalation.

###Darfur front

Fighting also broke out in Darfur, where the RSF and the SAF clashed with rebel groups. The conflict in Darfur has been ongoing since 2003, and the current conflict has exacerbated the humanitarian crisis in the region.

##October–December 2023

###SAF collapse in Darfur

In October 2023, the SAF suffered a series of defeats in Darfur, losing control of key towns and cities to rebel groups. The RSF also made gains in the region, further weakening the SAF's position.

###Peace negotiations stall

Peace negotiations between the SAF and the RSF stalled in October 2023, with both sides accusing each other of violating the ceasefire. The African Union and the United Nations continued to lead diplomatic efforts, but a breakthrough was not achieved.

###RSF Crossing of the Nile

In November 2023, the RSF crossed the Nile River, marking a significant escalation in the conflict. The RSF has been using the river to transport troops and equipment, further weakening the SAF's position.

##January–April 2024

###Hemedti travels abroad

In January 2024, Hemedti traveled to several countries, including Egypt and the United Arab Emirates, in an effort to secure support for the RSF. The trip marked a significant development in the conflict, as Hemedti sought to build alliances with regional powers.

###Fighting in Kordofan and Gezira

Fighting broke out in Kordofan and Gezira, two regions in central Sudan. The RSF and the SAF clashed, resulting in hundreds of casualties on both sides.

###SAF gains in Omdurman

In March 2024, the SAF made gains in Omdurman, a city in Khartoum state. The SAF launched a series of attacks on RSF positions, forcing the RSF to withdraw from the city.

##April 2024–present

###Fighting in Darfur

Fighting continues in Darfur, with the RSF and the SAF clashing with rebel groups. The conflict in Darfur has been ongoing since 2003, and the current conflict has exacerbated the humanitarian crisis in the region.

###Fighting in Kordofan

Fighting also continues in Kordofan, with the RSF and the SAF clashing. The conflict in Kordofan has resulted in hundreds of casualties on both sides.

###Fighting along the Nile

Fighting continues along the Nile River, with the RSF and the SAF clashing over control of the river. The Nile is a key transportation route, and control of the river is crucial to the conflict.

###SAF offensives

In April 2024, the SAF launched a series of offensives against RSF positions in Khartoum and other parts of the country. The offensives marked a significant escalation in the conflict, as the SAF sought to regain control of key cities and towns.

#Casualties

##Darfur

The conflict in Darfur has resulted in hundreds of casualties on both sides. The RSF and the SAF have clashed with rebel groups, resulting in significant humanitarian needs in the region.

##Sexual violence

Sexual violence has been reported in several parts of the country, with women and girls being targeted by armed groups. The conflict has exacerbated the risk of sexual violence, and international organizations have called for greater protection for civilians.

##Casualties among humanitarian workers

Several humanitarian workers have been killed or injured in the conflict. The SAF and the RSF have been accused of targeting humanitarian workers, exacerbating the humanitarian crisis in the country.

##Attacks on journalists

Journalists have also been targeted in the conflict, with several reporters and cameramen being killed or injured. The SAF and the RSF have been accused of restricting media access and targeting journalists who report on the conflict.

##Foreign casualties

##Notable deaths

###Egyptian POWs

The United Arab Emirates has also been involved in the conflict, with Emirati troops and equipment being deployed to support the SAF. The UAE has also been accused of providing military support to the RSF.

###Libyan National Army

The Libyan National Army has been involved in the conflict, with Libyan troops and equipment being deployed to support the RSF. The Libyan National Army has also been accused of providing military support to the SAF.

###Ukraine

Ukraine has been accused of providing military support to the RSF, with Ukrainian troops and equipment being deployed to Sudan. Ukraine has also been accused of providing military training to the RSF.

###United Kingdom

The United Kingdom has been involved in the conflict, with British troops and equipment being deployed to support the SAF. The UK has also been accused of providing military support to the RSF.

##Evacuation of foreign nationals

Several foreign nationals have been evacuated from Sudan, including diplomats and aid workers. The conflict has resulted in a significant escalation of violence, with international organizations calling for greater protection for civilians.

##Sanctions

Several countries have imposed sanctions on Sudan, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and the European Union. The sanctions have targeted the SAF and the RSF, as well as several individuals accused of human rights abuses.

###United States

The United States has imposed sanctions on Sudan, including restrictions on travel and financial transactions. The US has also provided humanitarian assistance to Sudan, including food and medical aid.

###Other countries

Several other countries have imposed sanctions on Sudan, including the United Kingdom, France, and Germany. The sanctions have targeted the SAF and the RSF, as well as several individuals accused of human rights abuses.

#Humanitarian impact

##Refugees

The conflict has resulted in a significant humanitarian crisis, with hundreds of thousands of people displaced. The conflict has also resulted in a significant influx of refugees into neighboring countries, including Chad and the Central African Republic.

#Economic impact

The conflict has had a significant economic impact on Sudan, with the country's economy suffering as a result of the conflict. The conflict has also resulted in a significant decline in the country's oil production, which has had a major impact on the economy.

#War crimes investigations

Several war crimes investigations have been launched into the conflict, including by the International Criminal Court. The investigations have targeted several individuals accused of human rights abuses, including military leaders and politicians.

#Disinformation

##Examples

Adipurush is an upcoming Indian epic action film directed by Om Raut and produced by T-Series and Retrophiles. The film is a rendition of the Hindu epic Ramayana, with a modern twist. It features a star-studded cast, including Prabhas, Kriti Sanon, and Saif Ali Khan, and is set to release in multiple languages.

# Plot

The film's plot is an adaptation of the Ramayana, with a modern spin. It tells the story of Lord Rama, played by Prabhas, who is on a mission to save his wife, Sita, played by Kriti Sanon, from the clutches of the demon king Ravana, played by Saif Ali Khan. The film also explores the character of Hanuman, played by Devdatta Nage, and his devotion to Rama.

Swashbuckle (TV series)

Swashbuckle is a British children's television series that premiered on CBeebies in 2013. The show is set in a pirate-themed world and features a mix of comedy, adventure, and educational content. The series is aimed at preschool-age children and is designed to promote social skills, emotional intelligence, and creativity.

# Format

Each episode of Swashbuckle is approximately 30 minutes long and features a unique storyline and set of challenges. The show is hosted by two presenters, Gem and Guy, who play the roles of swashbuckling adventurers. The presenters are joined by a group of pirate captains and their crews, who compete against each other in various games and challenges. The show also features a variety of animated segments, including songs, stories, and educational content.

The format of the show is designed to be engaging and interactive, with the presenters encouraging children to participate and join in on the fun. Each episode features a range of activities, including treasure hunts, obstacle courses, and creative challenges. The show also includes a strong focus on social skills, with the presenters and pirate captains modeling positive behaviors such as sharing, cooperation, and empathy.

# Main characters

The main characters in Swashbuckle are the presenters, Gem and Guy, and the pirate captains, who are the main competitors on the show. The presenters play the roles of swashbuckling adventurers, who guide the pirate captains and their crews through the various challenges and games. The pirate captains are the leaders of their respective crews and are responsible for making decisions and strategizing during the challenges.

## Presenters

Gem is one of the presenters of Swashbuckle and plays the role of a swashbuckling adventurer. She is a skilled sailor and navigator and is known for her bravery and quick thinking. Gem is also a talented singer and musician and often performs songs and animations on the show.

Guy is the other presenter of Swashbuckle and also plays the role of a swashbuckling adventurer. He is a skilled swordsman and acrobat and is known for his agility and cunning. Guy is also a talented storyteller and often tells stories and shares jokes on the show.

## Pirate captains

The pirate captains are the main competitors on Swashbuckle and are the leaders of their respective crews. Each pirate captain has their own unique personality and skills, and they compete against each other in the various challenges and games. Some of the most notable pirate captains include:

* Captain Sinker: Captain Sinker is a gruff but lovable pirate captain who is known for his sailing skills and navigation abilities.
* Captain Cutlass: Captain Cutlass is a fierce and competitive pirate captain who is known for her sword fighting skills and bravery.
* Captain Clumsybeard: Captain Clumsybeard is a bumbling but lovable pirate captain who is known for his clumsiness and silly antics.

## Pirates

The pirates are the crew members of the pirate captains and participate in the various challenges and games on the show. Each pirate has their own unique personality and skills, and they work together as a team to help their captain win the challenges. Some of the most notable pirates include:

* Barnaby Blackheart: Barnaby is a skilled swordsman and acrobat who is part of Captain Cutlass's crew.

* Polly the Parrot: Polly is a colorful and chatty parrot who is part of Captain Clumsybeard's crew.

# Awards and nominations

article:
Thor: Love and Thunder is a 2022 American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics character Thor, produced by Marvel Studios and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures. It is the sequel to Thor: Ragnarok (2017) and the 29th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). The film is directed by Taika Waititi, who also co-wrote the screenplay with Jennifer Kaytin Robinson.

#Plot

The film follows Thor (Chris Hemsworth), who has been traveling through space with the Guardians of the Galaxy. However, he soon finds himself parted from his friends and must face a new threat in the form of Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale), a powerful and vengeful deity who seeks to destroy all gods. Thor must also confront his past and his feelings for his ex-girlfriend Jane Foster (Natalie Portman), who has become the new Thor and wields the mighty hammer Mjolnir.

As Gorr's threat becomes more imminent, Thor must join forces with Jane, the Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson), and Korg (Taika Waititi) to stop him and save the universe from destruction. Along the way, Thor must come to terms with his own identity and what it means to be a god, as well as confront his feelings of love and loss.

#Cast

* Chris Hemsworth as Thor
* Natalie Portman as Jane Foster / The Mighty Thor
* Christian Bale as Gorr the God Butcher
* Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie
* Taika Waititi as Korg
* Russell Crowe as Zeus
* Jaimie Alexander as Lady Sif
* Chris Pratt as Star-Lord
* Dave Bautista as Drax the Destroyer
* Karen Gillan as Nebula
* Sean Gunn as Kraglin
* Pom Klementieff as Mantis
* Bradley Cooper as the voice of Rocket Raccoon
* Vin Diesel as the voice of Groot

#Production

##Development

The development of Thor: Love and Thunder began in January 2018, when Marvel Studios announced that Taika Waititi would return to direct the sequel to Thor: Ragnarok. Waititi had previously expressed interest in exploring the character of Thor further and delving deeper into the mythology of the Marvel Universe.

###Writing

The screenplay for Thor: Love and Thunder was written by Taika Waititi and Jennifer Kaytin Robinson. The story is based on the Marvel Comics character Thor and draws inspiration from various comics, including the "Mighty Thor" series by Jason Aaron and Russell Dauterman. The script underwent several revisions, with input from Marvel Studios and the cast.

##Pre-production

Pre-production on Thor: Love and Thunder began in October 2020, with the cast and crew preparing for filming. The film's budget was estimated to be around $200 million, making it one of the most expensive films in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

##Filming

Principal photography on Thor: Love and Thunder began on January 26, 2021, in Sydney, Australia. The film was shot on location in Australia and also used studio soundstages. The cast and crew worked tirelessly to bring the story to life, with Chris Hemsworth performing many of his own stunts.

##Post-production

Post-production on Thor: Love and Thunder began in April 2021, with the film's editor, Mary Jo Markey, working closely with Taika Waititi to shape the final cut. The film's visual effects were created by several companies, including Weta Digital and Industrial Light & Magic. The score was composed by Michael Giacchino and Nami Melumad.

#Music

The score for Thor: Love and Thunder was composed by Michael Giacchino and Nami Melumad. The soundtrack features a mix of orchestral and choral pieces, with a focus on percussion and guitar. The film's score was performed by the Sydney Symphony Orchestra and recorded at the Sydney Opera House.

#Marketing

The marketing campaign for Thor: Love and Thunder began in April 2022, with the release of the film's first trailer. The trailer featured footage of Thor, Jane Foster, and Gorr the God Butcher, set to a haunting score. The film's promotional campaign included posters, TV spots, and social media promotions.

#Release

##Theatrical

Thor: Love and Thunder was released in theaters on July 8, 2022, in the United States and July 7, 2022, in the United Kingdom. The film was released in IMAX, 3D, and Dolby Cinema formats.

##Home media

Thor: Love and Thunder was released on digital platforms on September 8, 2022, and on DVD and Blu-ray on October 18, 2022. The home media release includes bonus features, such as deleted scenes and a making-of documentary.

#Reception

##Box office

Thor: Love and Thunder was a commercial success, grossing over $760 million worldwide. The film opened at number one at the US box office, earning over $144 million in its opening weekend.

##Critical response

Thor: Love and Thunder received generally positive reviews from critics, with an approval rating of 68% on Rotten Tomatoes. The film was praised for its visuals, action sequences, and performances, particularly from Chris Hemsworth and Natalie Portman.

##Accolades

Thor: Love and Thunder was nominated for several awards, including a Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Visual Effects and a Saturn Award for Best Superhero Film.

#Documentary special

A documentary special, "Assembled: The Making of Thor: Love and Thunder", was released on Disney+ on September 8, 2022. The special features behind-the-scenes footage and interviews with the cast and crew.

#Future

Thor: Love and Thunder is part of the Marvel Cinematic Universe's Phase Four, which also includes films such as Spider-Man: No Way Home and Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness. The film's ending sets up potential future storylines for the character of Thor and the Marvel Universe as a whole.

#Notes

Thor: Love and Thunder is the 29th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe and the fourth solo film featuring the character of Thor. The film's title is a reference to the comic book series "The Mighty Thor", which features Jane Foster as the new Thor.

Regina Martyrum High School

Regina Martyrum High School is a co-educational high school located in the heart of the city, serving students from diverse backgrounds and fostering a culture of academic excellence, creativity, and community service. With a rich history dating back to the early 20th century, the school has established itself as a reputable institution, producing well-rounded individuals who go on to make a positive impact in their chosen fields.

#History

Regina Martyrum High School was founded in 1925 by a group of visionary educators who sought to provide quality education to the growing population of the city. The school's name, which translates to "Queen of Martyrs," reflects its commitment to nurturing individuals who would become leaders and change-makers in their communities. Over the years, the school has undergone significant transformations, expanding its curriculum, facilities, and extracurricular programs to meet the evolving needs of its students.

In the 1950s, Regina Martyrum High School became a pioneer in incorporating vocational training into its curriculum, providing students with practical skills in areas such as woodworking, metalwork, and home economics. This innovative approach helped to establish the school as a leader in technical education, attracting students from across the region.

In the 1980s, the school underwent a major renovation, resulting in the construction of new classrooms, laboratories, and recreational facilities. This upgrade enabled the school to expand its academic programs, introducing new courses in computer science, foreign languages, and the arts.

Today, Regina Martyrum High School continues to evolve, incorporating cutting-edge technology, sustainable practices, and community engagement initiatives into its operations. article:
2023 Japan Open

The 2023 Japan Open was a badminton tournament that took place at the Maruzen Intec Arena Osaka in Osaka, Japan, from July 25 to July 30, 2023. It was the 12th tournament of the 2023 BWF World Tour and was part of the HSBC World Tour.

# Tournament

## Venue

The 2023 Japan Open was held at the Maruzen Intec Arena Osaka in Osaka, Japan. The arena is an indoor sports facility that has hosted several international badminton tournaments in the past.

## Point distribution

The 2023 Japan Open was a Super 750 tournament, which meant that the winners of the tournament would receive 11,000 points towards their BWF ranking.

## Prize pool

The total prize pool for the 2023 Japan Open was $850,000, with the winners of the men's and women's singles events each receiving $59,500.

# Men's singles

## Seeds

The top eight seeds in the men's singles draw were:

1. Viktor Axelson (Denmark)
2. Kento Momota (Japan)

2022–23 Independence Cup (Bangladesh)

The 2022–23 Independence Cup, also known as the Bangabandhu Independence Cup, is the 13th edition of the Independence Cup, an annual football tournament in Bangladesh. The tournament is organized by the Bangladesh Football Federation (BFF) to commemorate the country's independence from Pakistan in 1971. The competition features 13 teams from the Bangladesh Premier League and Bangladesh Championship League, as well as three teams from the Bangladesh Women's Football League.

# Participating teams

A total of 13 teams are participating in the 2022–23 Independence Cup. The teams are:

* 10 teams from the Bangladesh Premier League: Bashundhara Kings, Dhaka Abahani, Dhaka Mohammedan, Chittagong Abahani, Sheikh Jamal Dhanmondi Club, Saif Sporting Club, Sheikh Russel KC, Muktijoddha Sangsad KC, Rahmatganj MFS, and Uttar Baridhara SC.
* 3 teams from the Bangladesh Championship League: Fortis FC, Gopalganj Sporting Club, and Feni Soccer Club.
* 3 teams from the Bangladesh Women's Football League: Bashundhara Kings Women, Dhaka Abahani Women, and Siraj Srity Women's Sports Society.

# Venues

The 2022–23 Independence Cup will be held at three venues in Dhaka, Bangladesh. The venues are:

* Bangabandhu National Stadium, Dhaka
* MA Aziz Stadium, Dhaka
* Bir Sherestha Shaheed Shipahi Mostafa Kamal Stadium, Dhaka

# Draw

The draw for the 2022–23 Independence Cup was held on November 20, 2022, at the BFF House in Dhaka. The 13 participating teams were divided into four groups, with three teams in each group and one group having four teams. The draw was conducted by the BFF General Secretary, Abu Nayeem Shohag, and was attended by the representatives of the participating teams.

# Group summary

The four groups of the 2022–23 Independence Cup are:

* Group A: Bashundhara Kings, Sheikh Jamal Dhanmondi Club, and Fortis FC
* Group B: Dhaka Abahani, Saif Sporting Club, and Gopalganj Sporting Club
* Group C: Dhaka Mohammedan, Chittagong Abahani, and Feni Soccer Club
* Group D: Sheikh Russel KC, Muktijoddha Sangsad KC, Rahmatganj MFS, and Uttar Baridhara SC

# Round and dates

The 2022–23 Independence Cup will be held from November 27, 2022, to December 18, 2022. The competition will be held in a round-robin format, with each team playing the other teams in their group. The top two teams from each group will qualify for the quarter-finals.

# Match officials

The 2022–23 Independence Cup will feature a team of experienced match officials from Bangladesh and other countries. The match officials are:

* Referees: Mohammad Jalaluddin, Md Mizanur Rahman, and Md Anisur Rahman (all from Bangladesh)

# Qualifying play-offs

article:
Joe Martin (orangutan)

Joe Martin was a male orangutan that gained notoriety in the early 20th century for his appearances in films, circuses, and zoos. Born in the jungles of Borneo, Joe was captured and brought to the United States, where he became a popular attraction in the entertainment industry. His life was marked by numerous incidents, escapes, and behavioral issues, which ultimately led to his decline and disappearance from public records.

#Background

Orangutans, native to Indonesia and Malaysia, were highly sought after as exotic animals in the early 20th century. The demand for these great apes was driven by the growing entertainment industry, which saw them as a lucrative attraction. Many orangutans, including Joe Martin, were captured from the wild and brought to the United States, where they were trained to perform tricks and stunts for audiences.

#Biography

##Transoceanic shipment and first owners

Joe Martin was born in the jungles of Borneo around 1910. He was captured by animal traders and shipped to the United States, where he was sold to a exotic animal dealer. Joe's first owners were a family who kept him as a pet, but soon realized that caring for an orangutan was a significant challenge. They eventually sold Joe to a film production company, which saw potential in the charismatic ape.

##1915–1917: Breakout film and early work

Joe's film career began in 1915, when he appeared in a series of short films produced by the Thanhouser Company. His breakout film, "The Orangutan," was released in 1916 and showcased Joe's agility and intelligence. The film was a commercial success, and Joe became a sought-after actor in the film industry. He went on to appear in numerous films, often playing the role of a mischievous ape.

##1918: Influenza epidemic, and night-watchman incident

In 1918, the United States was hit by the Spanish flu pandemic, which affected millions of people. Joe's owners, fearing for his health, took extra precautions to protect him from the disease. However, Joe's curiosity and mischievous nature led him to escape from his enclosure, where he encountered a night-watchman. The incident ended with Joe being subdued and returned to his enclosure, but it marked the beginning of his reputation as a troublesome ape.

##1919: Escapes and Al Santell incident

In 1919, Joe escaped from his enclosure on multiple occasions, causing chaos and concern among his owners. One notable incident involved Al Santell, a film director who was working with Joe on a project. Santell claimed that Joe had attacked him, but witnesses disputed the account, suggesting that Joe was simply playing a prank on the director.

##1920: Tarzan incident

In 1920, Joe was cast in a film adaptation of Edgar Rice Burroughs' "Tarzan of the Apes." The film was a major production, and Joe's scenes were highly publicized. However, during filming, Joe became agitated and attacked one of the actors, causing a significant delay in production.

##1921: Continuing in show business, Ethel Stecker incident

Despite the incidents, Joe continued to work in the entertainment industry, appearing in films and stage shows. In 1921, he was involved in an incident with Ethel Stecker, a actress who claimed that Joe had bitten her. The incident led to a lawsuit, which was eventually settled out of court.

##1922–1923: Behavioral issues, death of Curley Stecker

In 1922, Joe's behavioral issues became more pronounced, and he was involved in several incidents that raised concerns about his safety and the safety of those around him. Tragedy struck in 1923, when Curley Stecker, a animal trainer who had worked with Joe, died from injuries sustained while working with the ape.

##1923–1927: Barnes Circus and Barnes City Zoo

In 1923, Joe was sold to the Barnes Circus, where he became a main attraction. He spent several years with the circus, performing tricks and stunts for audiences. In 1927, the circus was sold to the Barnes City Zoo, where Joe was kept in a large enclosure.

##1928–1931: Last reports

The last reports of Joe Martin date back to 1931, when he was still living at the Barnes City Zoo. However, his condition had deteriorated significantly, and he was no longer performing in public. The exact circumstances of his death are unknown, but it is believed that he died in the early 1930s.

* The Missing Link (1923)

##Gallery

#Notes

* The accuracy of some events and incidents may be disputed due to the passage of time and the lack of primary sources.

article:
Military History of Canada

The military history of Canada encompasses the history of armed conflict in Canada and its predecessors, from the earliest Indigenous-European conflicts to the present day. This history has been shaped by the country's strategic location, its relations with other nations, and the evolution of its military institutions.

#Warfare pre-contact

Before the arrival of European colonizers, Indigenous peoples in what is now Canada engaged in warfare for various reasons, including territorial disputes, resource competition, and cultural differences. These conflicts often involved small-scale skirmishes and raids, but could also escalate into larger battles.

#17th century

##Beaver Wars

The Beaver Wars, also known as the Iroquois Wars, were a series of conflicts between the Iroquois Confederacy and other Indigenous groups in the region, including the French and their Algonquian allies.

###1609–1667

The wars began in 1609, when the Iroquois Confederacy, a powerful alliance of five Native American nations, sought to expand its territory and control the beaver fur trade. The Iroquois clashed with French colonists and their Algonquian allies, including the Huron and the Algonquin.

###1668–1701

The conflict escalated in the late 17th century, as the Iroquois sought to expand their territory further and assert their dominance over the region. The wars ended in 1701, with the signing of the Great Peace of Montreal, which established a fragile peace between the Iroquois and the French.

##Early British-French colonial hostilities

The early British-French colonial hostilities in North America were a series of conflicts that took place from the late 17th to the mid-18th century. These conflicts were fueled by rivalries over territory, trade, and resources.

###Acadian Civil War and its subsequent seizure

The Acadian Civil War was a conflict that took place from 1640 to 1645, between the French and British colonists in what is now Nova Scotia and New Brunswick. The war ended with the British seizure of the region, which led to the forced deportation of the Acadian people in the mid-18th century.

##Anglo-Dutch Wars

The Anglo-Dutch Wars were a series of conflicts between England and the Dutch Republic that took place from the mid-17th to the early 18th century. These wars were fought over trade and territorial disputes.

##Nine Years' War

The Nine Years' War, also known as the War of the Grand Alliance, was a global conflict that took place from 1688 to 1697. The war involved many European powers, including England, France, and the Dutch Republic.

###English-maritime Algonquians conflict

The English-maritime Algonquians conflict was a series of clashes between English colonists and the Algonquian peoples of the Maritimes. These conflicts took place from the late 17th to the mid-18th century.

#18th century

##War of Spanish Succession

The War of Spanish Succession was a global conflict that took place from 1701 to 1714. The war involved many European powers, including England, France, and Spain.

##Father Rale's War

Father Rale's War was a conflict that took place from 1722 to 1725, between the English colonists and the Abenaki people of what is now Maine. The war was sparked by the English colonization of the region.

##Fox Wars

The Fox Wars were a series of conflicts that took place from 1712 to 1716, between the French colonists and the Fox Nation, a Native American people of the Great Lakes region.

##War of Austrian Succession

The War of Austrian Succession was a global conflict that took place from 1740 to 1748. The war involved many European powers, including England, France, and Austria.

##Father Le Loutre's War

Father Le Loutre's War was a conflict that took place from 1749 to 1755, between the English colonists and the Mi'kmaq people of what is now Nova Scotia and New Brunswick.

##Seven Years' War

The Seven Years' War was a global conflict that took place from 1754 to 1763. The war involved many European powers, including England, France, and Prussia.

###Early French success and Acadia

The French had early successes in the war, capturing the British fort at Louisbourg and forcing the British to abandon Acadia.

###British conquest of New France

However, the British ultimately won the war, capturing the French stronghold of Quebec and forcing the French to surrender New France.

##Pontiac's War

Pontiac's War was a conflict that took place from 1763 to 1766, between the British colonists and a Native American alliance led by Pontiac, a leader of the Ottawa Nation.

##American Revolutionary War

The American Revolutionary War was a conflict that took place from 1775 to 1783, between the British colonists and the Thirteen Colonies, which eventually became the United States.

###Quebec and Nova Scotia

The war had a significant impact on Quebec and Nova Scotia, which remained loyal to the British Crown.

###Consequences

The war led to the creation of the United States and the eventual independence of Canada from Britain.

##French Revolutionary Wars

The French Revolutionary Wars were a series of conflicts that took place from 1792 to 1802, between the French Republic and various European powers.

#19th century

##War of 1812

The War of 1812 was a conflict that took place from 1812 to 1815, between the United States and the British Empire.

###1813

The war began in 1813, with the American invasion of British North America.

###1814

The British responded with a series of victories, including the burning of Washington, D.C.

##Pemmican War

The Pemmican War was a conflict that took place from 1816 to 1818, between the North West Company and the Hudson's Bay Company, two rival fur trading companies.

##British forces in Canada in the mid–19th century

The British maintained a significant military presence in Canada during the mid-19th century.

###Local levies and recruitment

The British recruited local forces, including the Canadian militia, to supplement their regular army.

##Rebellions of 1837–1838

The Rebellions of 1837–1838 were a series of uprisings that took place in what is now Ontario and Quebec, against the British government.

##Conflicts during the Fraser Canyon Gold Rush

The Fraser Canyon Gold Rush was a series of conflicts that took place in the late 1850s, between the British colonists and the Indigenous peoples of the region.

##American Civil War

The American Civil War was a conflict that took place from 1861 to 1865, between the United States and the Confederate States of America.

##Fenian raids

The Fenian raids were a series of incursions that took place from 1866 to 1871, by Irish-American militants into British North America.

##British forces in Canada in the late–19th century

The British maintained a significant military presence in Canada during the late 19th century.

###Canadian enlistment in British forces after 1871

Many Canadians enlisted in British forces after 1871, serving in various conflicts around the world.

##Canadian militia in the late–19th century

The Canadian militia was a significant force in the late 19th century, playing a key role in the country's defense.

##Nile Expedition

The Nile Expedition was a British military campaign that took place from 1884 to 1885, in the Sudan.

##Late–19th century conflicts in western Canada

There were several conflicts in western Canada during the late 19th century, including the North-West Rebellion.

###Riel Rebellions

The Riel Rebellions were a series of uprisings that took place in what is now Manitoba and Saskatchewan, led by Louis Riel.

#20th century

##Boer War

The Boer War was a conflict that took place from 1899 to 1902, between the British Empire and the two independent Boer states in South Africa.

##Early 20th century military developments

The early 20th century saw significant military developments in Canada, including the creation of a Canadian navy.

###Creation of a Canadian navy

The Canadian Navy was created in 1910, with the passage of the Naval Service Act.

##First World War

The First World War was a global conflict that took place from 1914 to 1918, between the Allied Powers and the Central Powers.

###Canadian Expeditionary Force

The Canadian Expeditionary Force was a significant contributor to the Allied war effort.

###Air and sea operations

Canada played a significant role in air and sea operations during the war.

###Conscription

The Canadian government introduced conscription in 1917, to address manpower shortages.

###Commemoration

The war is commemorated in Canada through various memorials and ceremonies.

##Interwar period

The interwar period saw significant military developments in Canada, including the establishment of an air force.

###Intervention in Russia

Canada intervened in the Russian Civil War, as part of an Allied intervention.

###Establishing an air force

The Royal Canadian Air Force was established in 1924.

###Spanish Civil War

Canada maintained a policy of non-intervention during the Spanish Civil War.

##Second World War

The Second World War was a global conflict that took place from 1939 to 1945, between the Allied Powers and the Axis Powers.

###Canadian Army operations

The Canadian Army played a significant role in the Allied war effort.

###Naval operations

The Royal Canadian Navy played a significant role in the Battle of the Atlantic.

###Air operations

The Royal Canadian Air Force played a significant role in the war, including the Dambusters Raid.

###Industry and research

Canada made significant contributions to the war effort through industry and research.

##Cold War

The Cold War was a period of tension that took place from 1945 to 1991, between the United States and the Soviet Union.

###Korean War

Canada participated in the Korean War, as part of a United Nations coalition.

###Forces in Europe

Canada maintained a significant military presence in Europe during the Cold War.

###Unification of Canada's military

The Canadian military was unified in 1968, with the creation of the Canadian Forces.

###October Crisis

The October Crisis was a significant event in Canadian history, in which the Canadian military was deployed to respond to a separatist crisis in Quebec.

###Vietnam War

Canada maintained a policy of non-intervention during the Vietnam War.

##Post-Cold War

The post-Cold War period saw significant changes in the Canadian military, including a shift towards peacekeeping.

###Oka Crisis

The Oka Crisis was a significant event in Canadian history, in which the Canadian military was deployed to respond to a land claims dispute.

###Gulf War

Canada participated in the Gulf War, as part of a United Nations coalition.

###Somali Civil War

Canada participated in the Somali Civil War, as part of a United Nations coalition.

###Yugoslav Wars

Canada participated in the Yugoslav Wars, as part of a United Nations coalition.

#21st century

##War in Afghanistan

Canada participated in the War in Afghanistan, as part of a NATO coalition.

##Libyan Civil War

Canada participated in the Libyan Civil War, as part of a NATO coalition.

##Mali War

Canada participated in the Mali War, as part of a United Nations coalition.

##War against the Islamic State

Canada is participating in the war against the Islamic State, as part of a coalition of nations.

#Peacekeeping efforts

Canada has a long history of peacekeeping, dating back to the 1950s.

#See also

* Canadian Forces
* Royal Canadian Navy
* Royal Canadian Air Force
* Canadian Army
* Military history of Newfoundland

#References

* Granatstein, J.L. (2011). Canada's Army: Waging War and Keeping the Peace. University of Toronto Press.
* Morton, D. (2013). A Military History of Canada. McClelland & Stewart.

#Further reading

* Bercuson, D.J. (2007). The Patricias: The Proud History of the Princess Patricia's Canadian Light Infantry. Stoddart.
* Cook, T. (2010). The Necessary War: Canadians Fighting the Second World War. McClelland & Stewart.

#External links

* Canadian Forces website
* Royal Canadian Navy website
* Royal Canadian Air Force website
* Canadian Army website

article:
2023 Men's FIH Hockey World Cup

The 2023 Men's FIH Hockey World Cup was the 15th edition of the Men's FIH Hockey World Cup, the premier international men's field hockey championship organized by the Fédération Internationale de Hockey (FIH). The tournament took place from January 13 to January 29, 2023, in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela, India.

#Host selection

The FIH announced the host country for the 2023 Men's FIH Hockey World Cup in November 2019. India was selected as the host country, with the cities of Bhubaneswar and Rourkela serving as the venues. This marked the fourth time India has hosted the Men's FIH Hockey World Cup, after previously hosting the tournament in 1982, 2010, and 2018.

#Teams

A total of 16 teams qualified for the 2023 Men's FIH Hockey World Cup, with the top teams from each of the five continental championships earning a spot in the tournament.

##Qualification

The qualification process for the 2023 Men's FIH Hockey World Cup consisted of five continental championships, with the top teams from each tournament earning a spot in the World Cup. The continental championships were:

* 2022 Men's African Cup of Nations
* 2022 Men's Pan American Cup
* 2022 Men's Asian Cup
* 2022 Men's EuroHockey Championship
* 2022 Men's Oceania Cup

##Draw

The draw for the 2023 Men's FIH Hockey World Cup took place on September 8, 2022, in Bhubaneswar, India. The 16 teams were divided into four pools of four teams each, with the teams in each pool playing each other in a round-robin format.

##Squads

Each team was required to submit a squad of 18 players for the tournament. The squads were announced by each team in the days leading up to the tournament.

#Venues

The 2023 Men's FIH Hockey World Cup was played at two venues in India: the Kalinga Stadium in Bhubaneswar and the Birsa Munda International Hockey Stadium in Rourkela. The Kalinga Stadium has a seating capacity of 15,000, while the Birsa Munda International Hockey Stadium has a seating capacity of 20,000.

#Umpires

A total of 24 umpires were appointed by the FIH to officiate at the 2023 Men's FIH Hockey World Cup. The umpires were from 14 different countries and included some of the most experienced and respected umpires in the world.

#First round

The first round of the 2023 Men's FIH Hockey World Cup consisted of 24 matches, with each team playing three matches against the other teams in their pool.

##Pool A

Pool A consisted of Argentina, Australia, France, and South Africa.

##Pool B

Pool B consisted of Belgium, Germany, Korea, and Japan.

##Pool C

Pool C consisted of Chile, Netherlands, New Zealand, and Malaysia.

##Pool D

Pool D consisted of England, India, Spain, and Wales.

#Classification round

The classification round of the 2023 Men's FIH Hockey World Cup consisted of 24 matches, with the teams that finished 9th-16th in the first round competing for the lower places in the tournament.

##9th–16th place classification

The 9th-16th place classification matches were played on January 22-23, 2023.

##13th–16th place classification

The 13th-16th place classification matches were played on January 24, 2023.

##9th–12th place classification
